ko: 선생님이 나를 우리 형으로 착각하신 것 같아.

en: Our teacher separated us into two groups.
ko: 우리 선생님이 우리를 두 그룹으로 나누셨어.

en: Our teacher called our names in turn.
ko: 우리 선생님이 우리 이름을 차례대로 부르셨어.

en: The teacher mixed up our names.
The teacher assented to our plan.
The teacher corrects our exercises.
ko: 선생님이 우리 연습 문제 틀린 걸 고쳐주셔.

en: The teacher tells us to clean our classroom every day.
The teacher told us to be quiet.
The teacher admonished us that we should be silent.
The teacher gave us homework.
Our teacher told us that we should do our best.
ko: 우리 선생님은 우리가 최선을 다해야 한다고 말씀하셨어.

en: Our teacher told us what to read.
ko: 우리 선생님이 무엇을 읽어야 할지 알려주셨어.

en: Our teacher urged us to study harder.
ko: 우리 선생님이 공부 더 열심히 하라고 다그치셨어.

en: The teacher gave us a lot of homework.
The teacher made us repeat the word.
ko: 선생님이 그 단어를 계속 따라 하라고 하셨어.

en: The teacher showed us how to use a computer.
The teacher recommended this dictionary to us.
The teacher told us to stop chattering.
My teacher encouraged me to fulfill my ambitions.
The teacher was quite candid about my chances of entering Tokyo University.
ko: 선생님이 내가 도쿄대에 합격할 가능성에 대해 꽤 솔직하게 말씀하셨어.

en: The teacher didn't permit me to leave early.
The teacher let me off for being late.
The teacher allowed me to leave school early.
The teacher corrected the composition that I had prepared.
The teacher tried to accustom the children to school.
ko: 선생님이 애들이 학교에 적응하게 하려고 하셨어.

en: The teacher assuaged some work to every child.
ko: 선생님이 애들마다 할 일을 하나씩 맡기셨어.

en: The teacher lined the children up in order of height.
ko: 선생님이 애들을 키 순서대로 줄 세우셨어.

en: The teacher took part in the children's games.
The teacher told the kids to be quiet.
Teachers help to form the minds of children.
The teacher quizzed his pupils on English.
The teacher finished today's lesson.
The doctor is not available now.
The doctor isn't available now.
The teacher pointed to the blackboard.
The teacher wrote English sentences on the blackboard.
The teacher wrote French words on the blackboard.
The teacher wore a harsh expression on his face.
Our teacher seemed surprised.
The teacher ordered the classroom to be cleaned.
The teacher looked around the classroom and started to talk.
The teacher encouraged the students with praise.
The teacher tried to interest the students in current events.
ko: 선생님이 학생들한테 시사 문제에 관심을 갖게 하려고 하셨어.

en: The teacher criticized his students' compositions.
The teacher was surrounded by her students.
The teacher caught a student cheating in the exam.
ko: 선생님이 시험 중에 부정행위 하던 학생을 잡으셨어.

en: The teacher ran up the stairs.
The teacher illustrated his theory with pictures.
The teacher explained his theory using pictures.
ko: 선생님이 그림을 사용해서 본인의 이론을 설명하셨어.

en: The teacher was very fair when she marked our exams.
ko: 선생님은 우리 시험 채점하실 때 정말 공정하셨어.

en: Our teacher told us to go out into the ground at once.
ko: 우리 선생님이 당장 운동장으로 나가라고 하셨어.

en: The teacher may say nothing, grading the students on how much they participate, what they add to the discussion, and their leadership of it.
ko: 선생님이 아무 말씀 안 하실 수도 있지만, 참여도나 토론 내용, 그리고 리더십을 보고 점수를 매기셔.

en: The teachers teach all day long.
The teacher punished her students for using bad words.
ko: 선생님이 나쁜 말 쓴 학생들을 혼내셨어.

en: The teacher is busy looking over our tests.
Our teacher ran through the important points again.
The teacher told Mary to hold her tongue.
The teacher told Mary to shut up.
The teacher told Mary to be quiet.
The teacher got well again.
The teacher got quite well again.
The teacher, not having heard the bell, didn't stop talking.
ko: 선생님이 종소리를 못 들으셔서 말을 멈추지 않으셨어.

en: The teacher gave out the test papers after the bell rang.
ko: 선생님이 종이 울리고 나서 시험지를 나눠주셨어.

en: The teacher dismissed his class when the bell rang.
When the bell rang, the teacher ended the class.
ko: 종이 울렸을 때 선생님이 수업을 마쳤어요.

en: The teacher stressed the importance of taking notes.
The teacher talked on and on.
The teacher was worried by Tom's frequent absences from class.
The teacher concluded that Tom would pass the exam.
ko: 선생님은 톰이 시험에 합격할 거라고 결론 내리셨어요.

en: The teacher praised me for working very hard.
ko: 선생님은 제가 열심히 한다고 칭찬해 주셨어요.

en: The teacher asked me which book I liked.
ko: 선생님은 제가 어떤 책을 좋아하는지 물어보셨어요.

en: The teacher singled out Tanaka for praise.
The teacher handed out the tests.
The teacher reminded us to study hard for the test.
ko: 선생님이 시험 공부 열심히 하라고 다시 말씀해 주셨어요.

en: My teacher told me to turn in my paper as soon as possible.
ko: 선생님이 과제를 최대한 빨리 제출하라고 하셨어요.

en: The teacher distributed the leaflets.
My teacher warned me not to do it again.
ko: 선생님이 다시는 그러지 말라고 주의를 주셨어요.

en: The teacher explained the meaning of the word to us.
ko: 선생님이 우리에게 그 단어의 뜻을 설명해 주셨어요.

en: The teacher was impatient with the idle fellow.
The teacher took notice of the student's mistake.
The teacher pointed out the pupil's mistakes.
The teacher permitted the boy to go home.
ko: 선생님이 그 학생에게 집에 가도 된다고 허락하셨어요.

en: The teacher praised the boy for his honesty.
The teacher interpreted the passage of the poem.
ko: 선생님이 그 시 구절을 해석해 주셨어요.

en: The teacher explained to us the meaning of the poem.
ko: 선생님이 우리에게 그 시의 의미를 설명해 주셨어요.

en: The teacher was far from satisfied with the result.
Our teacher lives close by.
The teacher was immediately at work correcting that day's test.
ko: 선생님은 그날 시험지를 바로 채점하기 시작하셨어요.

en: The teacher gave John a prize.
The teacher told us that Columbus discovered America in 1492.
The teacher said that we must memorize these idioms.
ko: 선생님은 이 관용구들을 외워야 한다고 말씀하셨어요.

en: The teacher lulled us into thinking that we had won.
ko: 선생님은 우리가 이긴 줄로만 착각하게 만드셨어요.

en: I wonder if the teacher works here.
The teacher controls the class, usually standing in front of the students and lecturing to them during the lesson.
ko: 선생님은 보통 학생들 앞에 서서 강의하며 수업을 진행하세요.

en: The teacher stood before the class.
The teacher read a passage from the Bible to the class.
ko: 선생님이 반 아이들에게 성경의 한 구절을 읽어주셨어요.

en: The teacher scolded her class for being noisy.
It seems the teacher was disappointed.
Our teacher showed us different kinds of flowers and told us in passing that those flowers came from her garden.
ko: 선생님은 여러 종류의 꽃을 보여주며, 그 꽃들이 자기 정원에서 온 거라고 지나가는 말로 하셨어요.

en: The teacher sat on the chair.
The teacher spoke too fast for us to understand.
ko: 선생님 말씀이 너무 빨려서 이해할 수 없었어요.

en: The teacher pointed out your mistakes.
I guess our teacher is over fifty years old.
ko: 우리 선생님은 쉰 살이 넘으신 것 같아요.

en: The teacher went on talking for two hours.
ko: 선생님이 두 시간 동안 계속 말씀하셨어요.

en: Our teacher said that water boils at 100ºC.
Our teacher said, "Water boils at 100 degrees."
The teacher told his pupils not to forget that lesson.
ko: 선생님은 학생들에게 그 가르침을 잊지 말라고 하셨어요.

en: The teacher, waving his hand, called to me.
Our teacher made us clean the room.
The teacher asked me how the moon differs from the earth.
ko: 선생님은 달이 지구와 어떻게 다른지 저에게 물어보셨어요.

en: The teacher's talk stimulates Mary to study harder.
ko: 선생님의 말씀이 메리가 공부를 더 열심히 하도록 자극을 주었어요.

en: What the teacher said got Mary to study harder.
ko: 선생님이 하신 말씀 덕분에 메리가 더 열심히 공부하게 되었어요.

en: What the teacher said encouraged Mary to study harder.
ko: 선생님의 말씀이 격려가 되어 메리가 더 열심히 공부했어요.

en: According to our teacher, she entered the hospital.
The teacher's name was Mr Grey.
The teacher's name was Mr. Grey.
I found out about a back-door registration technique from his secretary.
In spite of the teacher's warning, the lazy boy comes late as often as not.
ko: 선생님이 주의를 줬는데도 그 게으른 애는 걸핏하면 늦어.

en: You should act on your teacher's advice.
ko: 선생님 조언대로 하는 게 좋을 거야.

en: We couldn't help laughing at the teacher's joke.
ko: 선생님 농담 때문에 웃음을 참을 수가 없었어.

en: You had better yield to your teacher's advice.
ko: 선생님 조언을 따르는 게 나을 거야.

en: He was confounded at the sight of the teacher.
The teacher's words put Mary in a cold sweat.
What the teacher said made Mary break out into a cold sweat.
ko: 선생님이 하신 말씀 때문에 메리는 식은땀이 났어.

en: My teacher's word often come back to me.
Attend to what your teacher says.
I don't understand what the teacher said.
You must pay attention to what your teacher says.
I wish I could speak English the way my teacher does.
You must pay attention to the teacher.
You must heed the advice of your teacher.
Let's ask the teacher.
I couldn't care less if the teacher is mad at me.
ko: 선생님이 화를 내시든 말든 난 상관없어.

en: Why do you not ask your teacher for advice?
Why don't you ask your teacher for advice?
Let's have our composition corrected by the teacher.
Can the doctor see me this week?
ko: 이번 주에 의사 선생님을 뵐 수 있을까요?

en: I gave an answer that was way out in left field when the teacher caught me off-guard and called on me.
ko: 선생님이 갑자기 시키셔서 당황하는 바람에 완전 엉뚱한 대답을 해버렸어.

en: When the teacher called on me all of a sudden I got confused and kept stumbling as I spoke.
ko: 선생님이 갑자기 나를 시키니까 당황해서 말을 계속 더듬었어.

en: After I had handed in my report to the teacher, I had to start writing another.
ko: 선생님께 보고서를 내고 나서 또 다른 걸 써야 했어.

en: Please remember me to your teacher.
I will tell the teacher all about it.
There are teachers and teachers.
Now I am a teacher, I think otherwise.
ko: 이제 나도 선생님이 되고 보니 생각이 달라졌어.

en: To the professor, she was a joy to teach.
ko: 교수님은 걔를 가르치는 걸 정말 좋아하셨어.

en: As far as the teacher was concerned, she was a joy to teach.
ko: 선생님 입장에선 걔를 가르치는 게 정말 즐거웠어.

en: For the teacher, teaching her was fun.
Ask your teacher where to place the accent.
ko: 어디에 강세를 둬야 하는지 선생님께 여쭤봐.

en: Did you inform your teacher of this?
Tell the teacher your name.
After I talked with my teacher, I decided to work hard.
ko: 선생님이랑 상담하고 나서 열심히 하기로 했어.

en: Can I speak to the doctor?
May I speak to the professor?
The teacher and I sat face to face.
There are teachers and then there are teachers.
Even the teacher could not solve the problem.
Even a teacher can make mistakes.
The teachers assembled their classes in the gymnasium.
The teachers were divided on the issue.
ko: 그 문제에 대해서 선생님들 의견이 갈렸어.

en: The teachers could not decide where to build the new schoolhouse.
ko: 선생님들은 새 학교 건물을 어디에 지을지 정하지 못했어.

en: There comes our teacher.
There comes our teacher. He is walking very slowly.
Hardly had the teacher entered the room when we stopped chatting.
ko: 선생님이 교실에 들어오시자마자 우리는 수다를 멈췄어.

en: She stood up when her teacher came in.
Stop talking when the teacher comes in.
They carried on talking even after the teacher came in.
The teacher intervened in the quarrel between the two students.
ko: 선생님이 학생 둘이 싸우는 거 말리셨어.

en: I saw the teacher walk across the street.
When the teacher started shouting, they dropped what they were doing and ran out.
ko: 선생님이 소리 지르기 시작하니까 걔네 하던 거 멈추고 뛰어나갔어.

en: A teacher is sitting among the pupils.
ko: 선생님 한 분이 학생들 사이에 앉아 계셔.

en: Our teacher had hardly finished the class when the bell rang.
ko: 선생님 수업이 끝나자마자 바로 종이 울렸어.

en: Right after the teacher finished the class the bell rang.
Everyone was silent as the teacher was announcing the results of the examination.
ko: 선생님이 시험 결과 발표하실 때 다들 조용히 있었어.

en: My teacher put in a good word for me.
While the teacher was teaching, the students slept.
The teacher is coming along.
Not all teachers behave like that.
ko: 모든 선생님이 다 그러시는 건 아냐.

en: The teacher had a bad cold.
The teacher cannot have said such a thing.
ko: 선생님이 그런 말씀을 하셨을 리가 없어.

en: The teacher can't have said such a thing.
ko: 선생님이 그런 말을 하셨을 리 없어.

en: The teacher interpreted the sentence for us.
ko: 선생님이 우리한테 그 문장을 해석해 주셨어.

en: The teacher will illustrate how to do it.
I recognized the teacher at once, because I had met him before.
ko: 전에 뵌 적이 있어서 선생님을 바로 알아봤어.

en: Here comes our teacher.
Rabbi, we know you are a teacher who has come from God.
ko: 랍비님, 저희는 선생님이 하나님께로부터 오신 분이라는 걸 알아요.

en: Professor, what do you think of the situation in the Middle East?
ko: 교수님, 중동 상황에 대해 어떻게 생각하세요?

en: Do I have to bring my son to your office, Doctor?
ko: 선생님, 제 아들을 병원으로 데려가야 하나요?

en: Doctor, cure me.
I have a stomachache, doctor.
I won't ever talk in class again.
Rabbi, that man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan - the one you testified about - well, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him.
ko: 랍비님, 요단강 건너편에서 선생님과 함께 계셨던 분, 선생님이 증언하셨던 그분이 지금 세례를 주고 있는데 사람들이 다 그분한테 가고 있어요.

en: Sir, do we have to write in ink?
Thank you very much, doctor.
Doctor, please give this child first aid.
ko: 선생님, 이 아이 응급처치 좀 해주세요.

en: Thank you, Doctor.
Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel.
ko: 랍비님, 당신은 하나님의 아들이시고 이스라엘의 왕이세요.

en: The first blow is half the battle.
While the birth rate is intended to be decreased in developing countries, that of developed nations is selfishly planned to be increased, resulting in the difficulty of getting mutual consent.
ko: 개발도상국은 출산율을 낮추려고 하는데 선진국은 이기적으로 높이려고 해서 서로 합의하기가 힘들어.

en: Advanced countries must give aid to developing countries.
The countries should aid the countries much more.
ko: 그 나라들이 다른 나라들을 훨씬 더 많이 도와야 해.

en: The leaders of seven industrial democracies will meet in Okinawa in 2000.
I had to write a paper on the Space Age last weekend.
ko: 지난 주말에 우주 시대에 관한 리포트를 써야 했어.

en: Last week, I mailed him some souvenirs from the U.S.
ko: 지난주에 걔한테 미국 기념품 좀 부쳤어.

en: He was sick last week.
He won the prize last week.
I still owe my brother the ten dollars that he lent me last week.
ko: 지난주에 형이 빌려준 10달러 아직 못 갚았어.

en: We took an examination in math last week.
I met his sister last week.
I went to see his older sister last week.
I went to see his sister last week.
I had him paint the gate last week.
The eel I caught last week is still alive.
We visited the museum last week.
Let's resume reading where we left off last week.
ko: 지난주에 읽다 만 데부터 다시 읽자.

en: Last week five students were absent from class.
I met Meg in Kyoto last week.
Who was absent from school last week?
I took a day off last week.
Up to last week, I hadn't received a reply.
Last week I gained another five pounds.
I was very busy last week.
I ran into Mary at a party last week.
It has been raining since last Thursday.
What did you do last Sunday?
My family went to the zoo to see pandas last Sunday.
ko: 지난 일요일에 우리 가족이랑 판다 보러 동물원 갔어.

en: We saw a funny movie last Sunday.
I remembered riding home in a pickup truck last Sunday.
ko: 지난 일요일에 픽업트럭 타고 집에 오던 게 생각났어.

en: It has been raining since last Sunday.
When I met Hanako last Sunday, she said she had returned three days before.
ko: 지난 일요일에 하나코를 만났을 때, 3일 전에 돌아왔다고 하더라.

en: I went shopping last Saturday.
It has been raining since last Saturday.
Were you at the theater last Saturday?
Not a few students came to the concert last Saturday.
ko: 지난 토요일 콘서트에 학생들이 꽤 많이 왔어.

en: I saw an exciting baseball game last Saturday.
ko: 지난 토요일에 정말 신나는 야구 경기를 봤어.

en: I visited him this day last week.
I visited him a week ago today.
It has been raining since last Monday.
We had flooding because of last week's heavy rains.
We had the meeting in this room last Friday.
ko: 지난 금요일에 이 방에서 회의를 했어.

en: It has been fine since last Friday.
Last week's meeting was the longest we have had this year.
ko: 지난주 회의가 올해 들어 제일 길었어.

en: On last week's English test, my score was worse than hers.
ko: 지난주 영어 시험 점수가 걔보다 더 안 좋았어.

en: Do you know how many people turned up at the dance last week?
ko: 지난주 댄스파티에 몇 명이나 왔는지 알아?

en: There were some three thousand people who took part in the strike last week.
Last week the powerful Keidanren called on Tokyo to lift the ban.
ko: 지난주에 영향력 있는 게이단렌이 정부에 금지 조치 해제를 요구했어.

en: It was last week.
Father complains of having been busy since last week.
My dad is complaining; he's been constantly busy since last week.
ko: 우리 아빠가 지난주부터 쉴 새 없이 바쁘다고 불평하고 계셔.

en: There's been a constant stream of complaint calls since last week.

ko: 지난주에 우드 씨한테 편지 써서 네 일자리 좀 알아봐 달라고 부탁했어.
